runs.comm: excellent line and length, attacking the top of middle, and awkwardly defended
full again, driven loosely but straight, mid-on comes round to intercept
on off stump, poked into the covers
back of a length, but arrow straight. Defended into the covers off the back foot this time
down the leg side, a loud snick as it goes by and a huge appeal for caught behind! But Brian Jerling signals very clearly that that came off thighpad. Good decision I think
outside off, and that's a very late call for wide. So late in fact that the ad break had to be interrupted. Harsh as well I'd say
first run off the bat, and an appeal for a run-out as the shy hits the stumps at the non-striker's end. But that was safely home
so nearly a wicket first ball! A tentative edge, loops to second slip but bounces just in front of the skipper, Botha ...
appeal for lbw, but that clearly pitched outside leg
on leg stump again, but no room to attack his left-arm line
driven firmly into the gap in the covers, and that has enough legs to take them through for an all-run four. Ryan McLaren did well on the boundary's edge, but to no avail
driven uppishly into the covers, a fumble gives away a single
good line and length, watchfully defended off the back foot
fine line, half a yard outside off, with good carry through to the keeper
banged in short, a swished pull but bottom-edged into the crease
defended with a loud click of willow back down the crease. But there's no room to attack
a fraction over-pitched and that's clunked down the ground
boshed over the top again, this time out towards deep midwicket. More intent now
leg-stump yorker, comes out as a low full-toss but has the desired effect of a dot ball
strays onto the leg stump, and that's the wrong line
straining at the crease and clipped to square leg. Not quite the right line yet
attacking the pads again, but with no intent and a hint of swing this time
curling onto the pads, Masakadza can't cash in
defended to mid-on. And Taylor is permitted one delivery this over. Which seems to be his maximum allocation
duly defended by Taylor. His time will come, I'm sure
tight line and length
tapped to midwicket
width outside off, and cracked hard out to point. Good shot for no runs
beautiful delivery, a slower-ball yorker, looping above the eyeline before striking Taylor flush in front of middle. The end of an innings that never had a chance to get started
Trouble for Morne Morkel, who slips while fielding and has turned his ankle. That looks nasty, but he's able to put some weight on it as he is helped from the field
good slower ball. No contact on an attempted pull shot
on the pads and helped on its way. Not a good start
down the leg-side
that's a better line and length. Defended
quick single into the covers, they get there easily enough
better line and length from McLaren, who is finding his rhythm now
nips off the seam, strikes the pad, and another quick single into the off side
dabbed to backward point, and through they come
slower ball, into the blockhole, tapped to square leg
clobbered into the covers, but no way through there
another firm swipe of the blade, cut off by the cover sweeper
shorter, and banged into the ribs, fenced to short square leg
uppercut to third man, and Loots Bosman does superbly to cut off a certain four, intercepting with one hand
on the pads, another leg-bye to the total
good line and length, dabbed out to point
nurdled for a single to long-on
up and under, not really timed, but loops safely over point
quicker and flatter, smacked out to square leg
dropped! Down on one knee, smacked straight to David Miller at deep midwicket, and that was a sitter
tip and run, and a direct hit would have been dead. The shy came in from mid-on, and skimmed past by inches. Botha was poised, and could have had time to gather a lob
spanked into the covers, straight at the man
top boshing. A full swing of the blade, and that goes high over mid-off
an inside-out pull, lobs just out of reach of Parnell at short third man. Boundaries starting to flow, but so too the chances
finds the gap in the covers again
slower ball, flicked into the leg-side
a loose delivery to finish the over, on the pads and a full toss as well. Helped past the diving short fine leg for another four
driven down to long-on
more intent now, but nothing doing there
down the track and Botha sees him coming and spears it into leg stump
watchful bowling from Botha, following the batsman down the leg side
a loud appeal, but that was outside the line
excellent running to deep cover, but there shouldn't have been two on offer there. South Africa looking a bit rusty in their first match of the season
That's a freebie. Tonked over midwicket
a flowing cover-drive for another four, and that's the fifty stand. Top batting
worked along the ground for a single. Good cricket
driven back to the bowler, good line and length
worked out to midwicket
a single off the pads, and that's another good over for Zimbabwe
another single to the cause
flashed to long-on
big, big shot! Down on one knee, a towering slog-sweep, and Miller is again made to look a bit silly on the rope. Not a lot he could do as the ball plopped past his outstretched hands
tapped to backward point
worked back up the pitch
driven to mid-on, and Zimbabwe's calm progress continues
down on one knee, slightly short of a length, quick single to backward square
flicked to midwicket
that's massive! A wonderful open-shouldered swipe over deep midwicket, and that clears the rope by yards!
consecutive boundaries! Too much width outside off, slammed through the covers, and Chibhabha has his maiden fifty in T20Is
fuller and straighter
good batting, worked into space at mid-on for another single
Parnell returns to the attack with instant impact. A short ball, but Chibhabha's pull spirals off a top-edge, and after jinking round the square-leg umpire, Botha holds onto a simple chance
back of a length, dabbed to gully, and a direct hit would have been close
dabbed to square leg, and Chigumbura is off the mark first ball
slower-ball bouncer, chopped to the keeper who shies on his knees
good delivery, climbing outside off, and beats a swish
a thrashing drive, into the covers. He middled that, but can't beat the sweeper
drilled, in the air, over short cover, and there's no-one to cut that off. Top shot, played inside-out to the offspinner
knocks a single to deep midwicket
slow turn on a good length, tapped back to the bowler
cut with sublime placement through backward point, and that's another boundary as Bosman dives in vain!
tapped to midwicket, thoughts of a single, but sent back
flicked to mid-on
nothing on offer there
a swing and a miss
good delivery, a slower ball, and nibbles off the wicket as well
up onto the toes, and dabbed down to third man
short and pulled, without timing, but gets the single nonetheless
bouncer, onto him quickly and miscued to square leg. Lands safely
slower ball, into the  blockhole, chiselled into the  covers
crashing drive, swept up in the deep
poor delivery, full toss down the leg side. Kuhn does well to save the byes
cracking delivery, inswinging yorker, and the leg stump is plucked out of the ground! That's his maiden international wicket, well done him
driven down to long-off
a massive swing of the blade, picks the slower ball to perfection, and deposits it into the stands!
a crunching cut off a full toss. Technically speaking that was a chance, but backward point did well to save four
big appeal, and though that was demolishing middle stump, it clearly pitched outside leg. There should have been a run-out though!
short and swung away! Top-edged, but safely so, and that's Masakadza's half-century, from 55 balls, which is pretty brisk for an anchorman
driven on the up, to deep cover, a sharp relay shy to the keeper, but he's safely home
dancing feet and a flowing blade, and that's another vital boundary for Zimbabwe, through the covers again
another big hit! Another slower ball, swung high over deep midwicket, where Bosman tries to intercept, but in vain
driven down to long-on
great delivery, a leg-stump yorker and there's no getting that away
aiming for the blockhole, but he misses it. And the result is a sweet lofted drive into the stands!
a swing and a miss. A rarity
one more to the total
swished down to long on, and there wasn't ever two runs in that shot. Sure enough, the direct hit does the job, to end a brilliant innings from Masakadza
flogged through the covers! Beautiful strike and there's no-one who can cut that off
slow bouncer. Effective
too short, on the legs, and that's swung over backward square
monstrous! In the slot, loads of bottom hand, and pummelled into the deep midwicket stands!
slower ball, beats another ambitious swipe, but a cheeky single to the keeper
outside off, another single as the ball rolls to the keeper
chiselled out to deep midwicket, and that's the end of a fine effort from Zimbabwe's batsmen
